question_stem: A rectangle has a perimeter of 22 cm and an area of 28 cmÂ². Let the length of the rectangle be \(x\) cm and the width be \(y\) cm.

parts.question_text: Find the length and width of the rectangle.
parts.solution_text: The perimeter is given by \(2x + 2y = 22\), which simplifies to \(x + y = 11\), so \(x = 11 - y\). The area is given by \(xy = 28\). Substituting \(x = 11 - y\) into the area equation gives \((11 - y)y = 28\), which expands to \(11y - y^2 = 28\). Rearranging this gives \(y^2 - 11y + 28 = 0\). This quadratic factorises as \((y - 4)(y - 7) = 0\). Therefore, \(y = 4\) or \(y = 7\). If \(y = 4\), then \(x = 11 - 4 = 7\). If \(y = 7\), then \(x = 11 - 7 = 4\). So, the length is 7 cm and the width is 4 cm (or vice-versa).
